clinical_study.brief_title: Fondaparinux Population Pharmacokinetic to Morbid Obese Patients in Post-operatory Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Fondaparinux Population Pharmacokinetic to Morbid Obese Patients in Post-operatory Bariatric Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: After bariatric surgery , thromboembolics complications are major cause of mortality. However, in obese patients, thromboprophylaxia is a controversy. Fondaparinux' efficacy is superior to HBPM, and is a good treatment for this population. Pharmacokinetics information with Fondaparinux in this population are rare.

detailed_description.textblock: We proposed a bicentric study cohort of obese patients (BMI > 40 kg/m2) treated by 1 day injection of Fondaparinux 2.5 mg after bypass surgery. Anti-Xa activity of Fondaparinux will be measured 4 times during hospitalisation for each patient to realise a pharmacokinetic modelisation of Fondaparinux. Haemorrhage and thromboembolics events will be collected.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate pharmacodynamics parameters of fondaparinux based on anti-Xa activity estimated by a non linear model at mixed effect of obese morbid patients following a bariatric surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the incidence of symptomatic venous thromboembolics events (DVT and PE) between D5 and D10 and at 1month ± 10 days
the incidence of major and clinically significative bleeding between D5 and D10 and at 1 month ± 10 days

arm_group.description: Patient with 4 blood samples to measure anti-Xa activity

intervention.description: patients with a fondaparinux treatment who have 4 blood samples during the 10 days following surgery

biospec_descr.textblock: 4 blood samples to measure anti-Xa activity

study_pop.textblock: obesity patients who need a bariatric surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years old
- requiring a bariatric surgery
- requiring an antithrombotics prophylaxis
- having a morbid obesity based on a BMI >40 kg/m2
- having signed the inform consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- contra-indication to fondaparinux
- history of heparin induced thrombopenia (HIT)
- platelets < 100 G/l
- requiring an effective antithrombotic treatment
